meanings.sent1: The teacher had to reassign the homework because of the mistake.
meanings.sent2: The manager decided to reassign the project to a different team.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally reassign my shoes to the wrong feet this morning!
meanings.sent4: The puzzle pieces seemed to reassign themselves into a new pattern.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand could reassign objects to different locations with a flick.

meanings.definition: To transfer to a different position or task
meanings.sent1: The company will reassign the employee to a new department next week.
meanings.sent2: She asked her boss to reassign her to a more challenging project.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to reassign the mouse from its hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: The wind can reassign the fallen leaves to different parts of the yard.
meanings.sent5: The coach decided to reassign the player to a different position on the field.
